0.sentence-1: Respondents reported beliefs about the risk of COVID-19 to personal and public health , adoption and support of NPIs , willingness to be vaccinated against COVID-19 , and reasons for vaccination willingness .
0.sentence-2: We conducted a two-wave online survey conducted in February and November 2021 asking respondents their beliefs about COVID-19 risk perception , adoption and support of interventions , willingness to be vaccinated against COVID-19 , and reasons for vaccination .

1.sentence-1: We evaluated the association between disease status and COVID-19 behaviors or attitudes , adjusting for demographic and political factors .
1.sentence-2: Regression analysis was conducted to assess the relationship of respondents reporting a chronic disease and COVID-19 behaviors and attitudes , compared to healthy respondents adjusting for demographic and political factors .

2.sentence-1: The development of vaccines against SARS-CoV-2 would be greatly facilitated by the identification of immunological correlates of protection in humans .
2.sentence-2: The development of vaccines against SARS-CoV-2 would be greatly facilitated by the identification of immunological correlates of protection in humans .

3.sentence-1: However, to date, studies on protective immunity have only been performed in animal models and correlates of protection have not been established in humans .
3.sentence-2: However, to date, studies on protective immunity have been performed only in animal models and correlates of protection have not been established in humans .

4.sentence-1: Here, we describe an outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 on a fishing vessel associated with a high attack rate .
4.sentence-2: Here, we describe an outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 on a fishing vessel associated with a high attack rate .

5.sentence-1: Predeparture serological and viral RT-PCR testing along with repeat testing after return to shore was available for 120 of the 122 persons on board over a median follow-up of 32.5 days (range 18.8 to 50.5 days) .
5.sentence-2: Predeparture serological and viral reverse transcription-PCR (RT-PCR) testing along with repeat testing after return to shore was available for 120 of the 122 persons on board over a median follow-up of 32.5 days (range, 18.8 to 50.5 days) .

6.sentence-1: A total of 104 individuals had an RT-PCR positive viral test with Ct <35 or seroconverted during the follow-up period, yielding an attack rate on board of 85.2% (104/122 individuals) .
6.sentence-2: A total of 104 individuals had an RT-PCR-positive viral test with a cycle threshold (CT) of <35 or seroconverted during the follow-up period, yielding an attack rate on board of 85.2% (104/122 individuals) .

7.sentence-1: Metagenomic sequencing of 39 viral genomes suggested the outbreak originated largely from a single viral clade .
7.sentence-2: Metagenomic sequencing of 39 viral genomes suggested that the outbreak originated largely from a single viral clade .

8.sentence-1: Only three crewmembers tested seropositive prior to the boats departure in initial serological screening and also had neutralizing and spike-reactive antibodies in follow-up assays .
8.sentence-2: Only three crew members tested seropositive prior to the boat s departure in initial serological screening and also had neutralizing and spike-reactive antibodies in follow-up assays .

9.sentence-1: None of these crewmembers with neutralizing antibody titers showed evidence of bona fide viral infection or experienced any symptoms during the viral outbreak .
9.sentence-2: None of the crew members with neutralizing antibody titers showed evidence of bona fide viral infection or experienced any symptoms during the viral outbreak .

10.sentence-1: Therefore, the presence of neutralizing antibodies from prior infection was significantly associated with protection against re-infection (Fishers exact test, p=0.002) .
10.sentence-2: Therefore, the presence of neutralizing antibodies from prior infection was significantly associated with protection against reinfection (Fisher s exact test, P = 0.002) .
